quiz.text: Which one of the following organisations has recently (July 2023) released the Index mentioned in the passage?
options: Ministry of Commerce
NITI Aayog
Central Board of Indirect Taxes & Customs
WTO
World Customs Organization

quiz.text: The Index mentioned above recently (July 2023) released presents a comprehensive analysis of India’s export performance in FY22, along with its sector-specific and district-level merchandise export trends and evaluates the performance of the states across four pillars. Which of the following is not one of the pillars used by the index?
options: Policy
Time delay
Business Ecosystem
Export Ecosystem
Export Performance Export Performance

quiz.text: Recently (July 2023), the Index mentioned in the above passage was released by the NITI Aayog. Consider the following statements regarding the report.A. Tamil Nadu has topped the overall rankings with a score of 80.89.B. Gujarat has topped in the Landlocked category.C. Himachal Pradesh has topped the Himalayan State category.D. Delhi has topped the UT/Small state category. Which of the following statements are correct?
options: Only A
Only B
Both A and B
Both A and C
A, B, C and D

quiz.text: Recently (July 2023), the Index mentioned in the above passage was released by the NITI Aayog. Consider the following statements regarding the report. A. Karnataka has topped the policy pillar as well as the business ecosystem pillar of the Index.B. In the Export ecosystem pillar Gujarat has topped.C. In the Export performance pillar Maharashtra has topped.Which of the following above statements is incorrect?
options: Only A
Only B
Both B and C
Both A and C
A, B and C

quiz.text: Which one of the following organisations has recently (July 2023) released the report X mentioned in the passage?
options: World Bank
UNDP
NITI Aayog
Ministry of Consumer Affairs, Food and Public Distribution
Ministry of Rural Development

quiz.text: Consider the following statements regarding the recently (July 2023), released X report mentioned in the passage.A. India’s multidimensional poverty rate was 24.85% in 2015-16.B. India’s multidimensional poverty rate further increased to 34.96 in 2019-2021.C. Report also claims that about 13.5 crore people were added to the multidimensional poverty during the period (2015-16 to 2019-2021)Which of the following above statements are incorrect?
options: Only A
Only B
Both A and B
Both B and C
Only C

quiz.text: According to the recently (July 2023), released report X which is mentioned in the above passage, the rural areas witnessed the fastest decline in poverty from 32.59% to ________, primarily due to a decrease in the number of multi-dimensionally poor in States such as Bihar, Uttar Pradesh, Madhya Pradesh, Odisha, and Rajasthan while the  Multidimensional poverty in urban areas, during the same period, saw a decrease from 8.65% ________.
options: 18.28% & 6.27%
19.28% & 5.27%
17.28% & 4.27%
16.28% & 3.27%
15.28% & 2.27%

quiz.text:
Consider the following statements regarding the recently (July 2023) released report X mentioned above in the passage.

A. Bihar registered the largest decline in the number of poor with 3.43 crore people escaping multidimensional poverty.

B. Kerala have the least number of people facing multidimensional poverty in states.

C. Bihar tops the chart where the percentage of total population who are multidimensionally poor is high.

Which of the following above statements are correct?
options: Only A
Only B
Both A and B
Both B and C
None of the above

quiz.text: According to the recently (July 2023), released National Multidimensional Poverty Index: A Progress Review 2023 by the NITI Ayog, between 2015-16 and 2019-21, the Multidimension Index (MPI) value has nearly halved from 0.117 to _______ and the intensity of poverty has reduced from 47% to _______.
options: 0.099 & 55%
0.033 & 66%
0.066 & 44%
0.044 & 33%
0.022 & 22%

quiz.text: Which of the following organization has collaborated with the Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas (MOP&NG) recently (July 2023), in the release of an “Oil 2023 - Analysis and Forecast to 2028" report?
options: NITI Aayog
The International Energy Agency (IEA)
The International Atomic Energy Agency
The Organisation of the Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC)
None of the Above

quiz.text: According to the recently (July 2023), released “Oil 2023 - Analysis and Forecast to 2028" report, the overall consumption of petroleum products in FY 2022-23 was at ________, with a growth of about ________ over the previous year.
options: 233 MMT & 14%
243 MMT & 13%
223 MMT & 12%
253 MMT & 11%
263 MMT & 10%

quiz.text: Recently (July 2023), the International Energy Agency (IEA) in collaboration with Petroleum Planning and Analysis Cell (PPAC) under the aegis of MoP&NG launched the Oil 2023 medium-term market report, titled: Oil 2023 "Analysis and forecast to 2028".Consider the following statements regarding the report.A. India`s focus is on decarbonization and it has already achieved 12% ethanol blending in Petrol.B. India has targeted 25% blending by 2025.C. Alternate clean fuels like biofuels are expected to provide 15% of new liquid fuel supply growth to 2028.Which of the following statements are incorrect?
options: Only A
Only B
Both B and C
Both A and B
None of the above

quiz.text: According to the recently (July 2023), released report “Oil 2023 - Analysis and forecast to 2028" by The International Energy Agency (IEA) in collaboration with Petroleum Planning and Analysis Cell (PPAC), the investments in oil and gas exploration, extraction and production are on course to reach their highest levels since 2015, growing 11% year-on-year to ___________ in 2023.
options: USD 528 billion
USD 538 billion
USD 548 billion
USD 558 billion
USD 568 billion

quiz.text: According to the recently (July 2023), released Global Firepower Index 2023 by Global Firepower, which among the following country does not feature in top 4 in the list?
options: USA
Russia
India
United Kingdom
China

quiz.text: According to the recently (July 2023) released “Reserve Bank of India Bulletin - July 2023” by the Reserve Bank of India, India's real GDP needs to grow at __________ annually over the next 25 years to achieve the per capita income level to become a developed economy.
options: 7.2%
7.4%
7.6%
7.8%
7.9%

quiz.text: Recently (July 2023), the RBI released “Reserve Bank of India Bulletin - July 2023”.Consider the following statements regarding the report.A. India's per capita income is currently estimated at $3,500, while it must be more than $21,664 by 2047, as per World Bank standards, to be classified as a high-income country.B. As per World Bank classification, a country with a per capita income of US$ 13,205 or more in 2022-23 is classified as a high-income country.C. To become a high-income country by 2047-48, India’s per capita GDP in nominal terms would have to record a CAGR of 10.6% (9.1%).Which of the following statements are incorrect?
options: Only A
Only B
Both B and C
Both A and B
None of the above

quiz.text: Recently (July 2023), the RBI released the “Reserve Bank of India Bulletin - July 2023”. Consider the following statements regarding, how India can sustain growth over 25 years.A. Industrial sector should increase its share from the current 25.6% to 35% by 2047-48.B. Manufacturing should occupy a 25% share in total value added.C. Under manufacturing, the Industrial sector is required to grow at a nominal CAGR of 13.4%Which of the following statements are correct?
options: Only A
Only B
Both B and C
All of the above
None of the above

quiz.text: According to the recently (July 2023) released “Reserve Bank of India Bulletin - July 2023” by the Reserve Bank of India, if India manages to sustain the growth in exports of goods and services (nominal) at 13.3% over the next 25 years (as observed during the high growth phase of 1993-2017), their share in GDP would increase from 22.8% in 2022-23 to _________ by 2047-48.
options: 37.5%
40.5%
35.5%
30.5%
33.5%

quiz.text: Consider the following statements regarding the recently (July 2023) released report X mentioned in the above passage. A. 19% of the global population still lacks access to electricity.B. Investment of 192 billion US Dollars Required for Providing Energy to Unelectrified Population C. Cumulative solar capacity is expected to reach around 2050 GW by 2037Which of the following statements are correct?
options: Only A
Only B
Both B and C
All of the above
None of the above

quiz.text: According to the recently (July 2023) released Report _X_ mentioned in the passage, _________ of the global population still lack access to electricity.
options: 8%
9%
7%
6%
5%

quiz.text: Consider the following statements regarding the recently (July 2023) released report X mentioned in the above passage. Remaining 11% through Decentralized Renewable Energy solutions.Which of the following statements are correct?

quiz.text: Consider the following statements regarding the recently (July 2023) released report X mentioned in the above passage. A. The International Solar Alliance is an international organisation with 116 Member and Signatory countries.B. ISA’s mission is to unlock US$ 1 trillion of investments in solar by 2030 while reducing technology and its financing costs.C. Achieving Universal Energy Access by 2030, as outlined in Sustainable Development Goal 8Which of the following statements are incorrect?
options: Only A

Both B and C

quiz.text: According to the recently (July 2023) released “Henley Passport Index” by Henley & Partners, India has climbed seven places on Henley Passport Index 2023 to _________from ________ last year though the number of countries allowed visa-free access to Indian passport holders remain unchanged.
options: 60 & 67
70 & 77
90 & 97
80 & 87
50 & 57
